item.title: Building python distributions
item.description: Before you can distribute a package, you must first create a distribution. A distribution is a single file that bundles all the files and data necessary to install and use the package - but also sometimes compile and test it. A distribution usually takes the from of an archive (.tar, .zip or similar). There are several possible distribution formats, but in 2020, only two are really important: the source distribution (sdist) and the wheel (bdist_wheel).

item.title: Uploading distributions to PyPI
item.description: In the previous section you learned how to create distributions for your packages. In this section, we look at how to share them with others, so that other people can easily install and use your packages. Package repositories Let’s think about distributing packages for a minute. If you wanted to share one of your distributions (whether it’s a source distribution or a wheel distribution) with a colleague, how would you proceed?
